# Tutorials

Tutorials are **learning-oriented** lessons that take you through a series of steps to complete a project. They help you get started and build foundational skills.

## Available Tutorials

### [Getting Started](./getting-started.md)
Set up arch-explorer and render your first diagram. You'll learn:
- Installing dependencies
- Running the development server
- Loading a Mermaid diagram
- Understanding the basic UI

### [Your First Isometric View](./first-isometric.md)
Transform a flat diagram into an isometric (3D-looking) view. You'll learn:
- Toggling between flat and isometric modes
- How the CSS transform creates the 3D illusion
- Adjusting shapes for isometric rendering

### [Navigating Complex Diagrams](./navigation-basics.md)
Learn to explore large architecture diagrams. You'll learn:
- Using drill mode to focus on subgraphs
- Understanding breadcrumb navigation
- Zooming and panning

## What Makes a Good Tutorial

Tutorials in this project should:
1. Have a clear learning goal
2. Provide all necessary steps (don't skip anything)
3. Be repeatable - same steps, same results
4. Focus on learning, not on the final product
